005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.jsonFormatVisitors.JsonFormatTypes;
009
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.AbstractCustomJavaDataTypeAdapter;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.object.AmbiguousTime;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathConstants;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.ITimeItem;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.EQNameFactory;
015import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
016import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
017
018import java.time.LocalTime;
019import java.time.OffsetTime;
020import java.time.ZoneOffset;
021import java.time.format.DateTimeParseException;
022import java.util.List;
023
024import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
025
026/**
027 * Support for the Metaschema <a href=
028 * "https://pages.nist.gov/metaschema/specification/datatypes/#date">date</a>
029 * data type.
030 */
031public class TimeAdapter
032    extends AbstractCustomJavaDataTypeAdapter<AmbiguousTime, ITimeItem> {
033  @NonNull
034  private static final List<IEnhancedQName> NAMES = ObjectUtils.notNull(
035      List.of(
036          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "time")));
037
038  TimeAdapter() {
039    super(AmbiguousTime.class, ITimeItem.class, ITimeItem::cast);
040  }
041
042  @Override
043  public List<IEnhancedQName> getNames() {
044    return NAMES;
045  }
046
047  @Override
048  public JsonFormatTypes getJsonRawType() {
049    return JsonFormatTypes.STRING;
050  }
051
052  @Override
053  public AmbiguousTime parse(String value) {
054    AmbiguousTime retval;
055    try {
056      retval = parseWithTimeZone(value);
057    } catch (DateTimeParseException ex) {
058      try {
059        retval = parseWithoutTimeZone(value);
060      } catch (DateTimeParseException ex2) {
061        IllegalArgumentException newEx = new IllegalArgumentException(ex2.getLocalizedMessage(), ex2);
062        newEx.addSuppressed(ex);
063        throw newEx;
064      }
065    }
066    return retval;
067  }
068
069  @NonNull
070  private static AmbiguousTime parseWithTimeZone(@NonNull String value) {
071    return new AmbiguousTime(
072        ObjectUtils.notNull(OffsetTime.from(DateFormats.TIME_WITH_TZ.parse(value))),
073        true);
074  }
075
076  @NonNull
077  private static AmbiguousTime parseWithoutTimeZone(@NonNull String value) {
078    LocalTime time = LocalTime.from(DateFormats.TIME_WITH_OPTIONAL_TZ.parse(value));
079    return new AmbiguousTime(
080        ObjectUtils.notNull(OffsetTime.of(time, ZoneOffset.UTC)),
081        false);
082  }
083
084  @Override
085  public String asString(Object obj) {
086    AmbiguousTime value = toValue(obj);
087    return ObjectUtils.notNull(value.hasTimeZone()
088        ? DateFormats.TIME_WITH_TZ.format(value.getValue())
089        : DateFormats.TIME_WITH_OPTIONAL_TZ.format(value.getValue()));
090  }
091
092  @Override
093  public ITimeItem newItem(Object value) {
094    AmbiguousTime item = toValue(value);
095    return ITimeItem.valueOf(item);
096  }
097}
